A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Decent acting\, amazing visuals.
Poor\, forced through plot. 
Overt underlying political statements which contribute nothing to the story.
Complete retconning of all former lore regarding force and abilities and Luke Skywalker.
Introduction of creatures - porgs - to sell toys and other forms of commercial marketing which serve to erode the film as anything more meaningful then a cash grab.
Completely ridiculous moments put in for comic relief - e.g. Hux and Poe's exchange in the beginning scene.
 Leia's Mary Poppins moment. What!?
Everything about Holdo's character and then her and Leia's unsubstantiated mockery of Poe and the underlying gender politics which insults the majority of Star Wars' audience.
Phasma\, what is the point of her character?
Why try and make the First Order to be completely incompetent when they are supposed to be the terrifying force which is claimed to be such a threat yet never seems to have a redeeming moment?
A half-decent film\, but an awful film in terms of Star Wars. Its hard to see how the 9th film can redeem this new trilogy.
